Event.0: Al-Hussein (Al-Ḥusayn ibn) and his followers killed at Karbala by army of Yazid, the Umayyad caliph, on the way to Kufa
Event.1: The Netherlands Antilles—formerly an autonomous part of the Kingdom of the Netherlands consisting of a group of five islands in the Caribbean Sea—was officially dissolved.
Event.2: Actor and comedian Chris Kattan (37) divorces model Sunshine Tutt (32) due to irreconcilable differences after 2 months of marriage
Event.3: American motion-picture actor, director, producer, and writer Orson Welles died.
Event.4: Canadian hockey player Wayne Gretzky made his NHL debut, with the Edmonton Oilers.
Event.5: Actress Elizabeth Taylor (43) 6th marriage and remarriage to actor Richard Burton (49)
Event.6: Actress Elizabeth Montgomery (41) divorces director-producer William Asher (53) after 11 years of marriage
Event.7: Vice President Spiro T. Agnew resigned from office and pleaded no contest to the charge of failing to report $29,500 in income while governor of Maryland.
Event.8: Fiji gained independence from Great Britain.
Event.9:
Brett Favre
American football player
was born
Event.10: American gridiron football player Brett Favre, who broke all the major NFL career passing records as quarterback of the Green Bay Packers, was born.
Event.11: "Jesus Christ Superstar" soundtrack album by Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice is recorded
Event.12: A fire at the Windscale nuclear plant in Cumbria, England becomes the world's first major nuclear accident
Event.13: 1st National Film Awards (India): "Shyamchi Aai" wins the Golden Lotus
Event.14: Ho Chi Minh enters Hanoi after withdrawal of French troops
Event.15:
Nora Roberts
American novelist
was born
Event.16: George Gershwin's opera Porgy and Bess opened on Broadway.
Event.17:
Harold Pinter
British dramatist
was born
Event.18: American pianist and composer Thelonious Monk, among the first creators of modern jazz, was born.
Event.19:
Thelonious Monk
American musician
was born
Event.20: A group of revolutionaries launched an uprising in Wuchang, China, which many regard as the formal beginning of the Chinese Revolution, a nationalist democratic revolt that overthrew the Qing dynasty.
Event.21:
R.K. Narayan
Indian author
was born
Event.22: African-American inventor Issac R. Johnson patents the bicycle frame
Event.23: English astronomer William Lassell discovered Triton, the largest satellite of the planet Neptune.
Event.24:
Founding of the U.S. Naval Academy 
To improve the then-unsatisfactory methods of instructing midshipmen, George Bancroft—historian, educator, and secretary of the navy—founded the U.S. Naval Academy in Annapolis, Maryland, on this day in 1845.
Event.25: Great Hurricane of 1780 kills 20,000 to 30,000 in Caribbean, hitting Barbados first. Atlantic's deadliest recorded hurricane.
Event.26: Composer Antonio Salieri (24) weds Therese Helferstorfer
Event.27: American revolution patriot Paul Revere (38) weds Rachel Walker in Boston, Massachusetts
